definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: Objective To explore whether PT can be used as good medicine as SD.

sentences.english: Charlier points out that mummies were used in Europe during the Middle Ages in pharmaceutical remedies.

definition: to relieve (cold, rheumatic pain etc)/lit. to dispel pathogenic wind (TCM)
Compendium of Medical Herbs 1596, compiled by Li Shizhen 李時珍|李时珍[Li3 Shi2 zhen1]
to invigorate blood circulation and alleviate pain (idiom)
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
Shennong's Compendium of Materia Medica, a Han dynasty pharmacological compendium, 3 scrolls
